subject: [Ussuri and before] Bump puppet-memcached for tls support
messages:
[{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-30 07:37:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2021-03-30 08:00:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2021-03-30 11:00:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

For memcached TLS, puppet-memcached v6.0.0 is required.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-30 11:08:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> For memcached TLS, puppet-memcached v6.0.0 is required.

IMO, major bump of requirement in stable branches are unacceptable in general, and what we should avoid.
I have reviewed the proposed implementation of puppet-tripleo but as long as I see it is enough if we have puppet-memcached 3.7.0.
Thus I prefer to limit the bump within the same major version instead of making major bump at this time.'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2021-03-30 12:23:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > For memcached TLS, puppet-memcached v6.0.0 is required.
> 
> IMO, major bump of requirement in stable branches are unacceptable in general, and what we should avoid.
> I have reviewed the proposed implementation of puppet-tripleo but as long as I see it is enough if we have puppet-memcached 3.7.0.
> Thus I prefer to limit the bump within the same major version instead of making major bump at this time.

The field memcached::listen was only introduced in v6.0.0 to support no_tls listeners, most changes from 3.7.0 to 6.0.0 are just cosmetic. But it looks like the ussuri patches are passing the check.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-30 12:33:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> > > 
> > > For memcached TLS, puppet-memcached v6.0.0 is required.
> > 
> > IMO, major bump of requirement in stable branches are unacceptable in general, and what we should avoid.
> > I have reviewed the proposed implementation of puppet-tripleo but as long as I see it is enough if we have puppet-memcached 3.7.0.
> > Thus I prefer to limit the bump within the same major version instead of making major bump at this time.
> 
> The field memcached::listen was only introduced in v6.0.0 to support no_tls listeners, most changes from 3.7.0 to 6.0.0 are just cosmetic. But it looks like the ussuri patches are passing the check.

That parameter is not directly used from puppet-tripelo but set by tripleo-heat-templates via hieradata.
Current problem is that the version of puppet-memcached doesn't provide the three parameters (use_tls, tls_cert_chain and tls_key), and these 3 parameters will be available once we have 3.7.0 , so using 3.7.0 is enough to unblock unit tests .
Note that functionality is tested in tripleo jobs which use packages from rdo including puppet-memcached 6.0.0 .

Note that puppet-memcached is still pinned to 5.0.0 even in master and wallaby we are cutting off now. So if we need to bump that to 6.0.0 then we should bump all versions from master to train, and this does take a bit time because we should hold any backport until wallaby branch is created, so that we don't create any patch missing from Wallaby but backported to Victoria.

As I mentioned ealier bumping requirement in stable branch is something we should avoid as possible. Thus I believe current approach to make minimum bump to unblock gate is the best approach here."}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2021-03-30 13:45:20.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-1 by Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2021-03-30 13:45:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 1:
> > > 
> > > > Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> > > > 
> > > > For memcached TLS, puppet-memcached v6.0.0 is required.
> > > 
> > > IMO, major bump of requirement in stable branches are unacceptable in general, and what we should avoid.
> > > I have reviewed the proposed implementation of puppet-tripleo but as long as I see it is enough if we have puppet-memcached 3.7.0.
> > > Thus I prefer to limit the bump within the same major version instead of making major bump at this time.
> > 
> > The field memcached::listen was only introduced in v6.0.0 to support no_tls listeners, most changes from 3.7.0 to 6.0.0 are just cosmetic. But it looks like the ussuri patches are passing the check.
> 
> That parameter is not directly used from puppet-tripelo but set by tripleo-heat-templates via hieradata.
> Current problem is that the version of puppet-memcached doesn't provide the three parameters (use_tls, tls_cert_chain and tls_key), and these 3 parameters will be available once we have 3.7.0 , so using 3.7.0 is enough to unblock unit tests .
> Note that functionality is tested in tripleo jobs which use packages from rdo including puppet-memcached 6.0.0 .
> 
> Note that puppet-memcached is still pinned to 5.0.0 even in master and wallaby we are cutting off now. So if we need to bump that to 6.0.0 then we should bump all versions from master to train, and this does take a bit time because we should hold any backport until wallaby branch is created, so that we don't create any patch missing from Wallaby but backported to Victoria.
> 
> As I mentioned ealier bumping requirement in stable branch is something we should avoid as possible. Thus I believe current approach to make minimum bump to unblock gate is the best approach here.

thanks for the clarification Takashi o/"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-03-30 16:22:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-30 22:37:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-30 07:37:24.000000000', 'message': '[Ussuri and before] Bump puppet-memcached for tls support

Currently in TripleO we are implementing tls support for memcached,
which requires puppet-memcached >= 3.7.0. This change bumps version of
puppet-memcached used during tets to the one with tls support, so that
we can use the proper version of puppet-memcached in unit tests of
puppet-tripleo.
Because there are no changes made until 3.7.0 which is likely to
break interfaces used in current puppet modules it is considered to
be safe to bump that minor version at this moment.

Related-Bug: #1921716
Change-Id: Ib213e151b92d33d30f4335fcd93f86dbab8f0198
(cherry picked from commit 1e7739c97e527c4afad705ff6bdae0f8edd8be64)
'}]
commit_message:
[Ussuri and before] Bump puppet-memcached for tls support

Currently in TripleO we are implementing tls support for memcached,
which requires puppet-memcached >= 3.7.0. This change bumps version of
puppet-memcached used during tets to the one with tls support, so that
we can use the proper version of puppet-memcached in unit tests of
puppet-tripleo.
Because there are no changes made until 3.7.0 which is likely to
break interfaces used in current puppet modules it is considered to
be safe to bump that minor version at this moment.

Related-Bug: #1921716
Change-Id: Ib213e151b92d33d30f4335fcd93f86dbab8f0198
(cherry picked from commit 1e7739c97e527c4afad705ff6bdae0f8edd8be64)

commit_message:
Fix OVS conjunctive IP flows cleanup

 Currently when deleting a remote-group's member IPs, the deleted IPs'
 conjunctive flows are not cleaned up in OF tables. This is because
 the conjunctive flows' cookies don't match with the OVSBridge default
 cookie used by the delete flow method. This patch fixed the issue by
 using an ANY cookie that can always match with the cookies of the
 conjunctive flows.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/linux/openvswitch_firewall/firewall.py

Change-Id: I74916acf8311989dca267f23261ec4cf449a6abf
Closes-Bug: 1907491
(cherry picked from commit f4b64e519cdb9fd9c5046f21bc9f325341fd367f)
(cherry picked from commit 03f0a832a82f35286417e56d6071cfefe823a65c)

commit_message:
Drop pbr version ceiling and add py39 testing

- Ceiling of pbr version can create installation conflicts with pip.
- Fixes tox default env list to be python version agnostic
- Updated template to use newer jobs (include testing with newer python)

Bug: #1921679
Change-Id: Ifd0d2f810799992faa1db41b80bf93bc97d5d19d

commit_message:
Set vlan-limit value depending on vlan_transparent setting

In case when vlan_transparent in Neutron is enabled,
other_config:vlan-limit should be set to value "0" in the openvswitch on
all nodes.

Related-Bug: #1918418

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-vswitch/+/779796
Change-Id: Id6fc08bce5673a41fd9fa5cb27f41c9786f560da

We see many issue in CI due to the missing hdd device class.
This is something that can be related to the fact the only
OSD in this job is built on top of a loop device. For this
reason, and in order to keep the CI healthy, it's safe
removing the device classes coverage.

tiering in this context makes no sense.

Change-Id: I4638b9badd17a7a75642895623a63753534fd341

commit_message:
Remove CrushRules coverage from scenario001

We see many issues in CI due to the missing hdd device class.
This is something that can be related to the fact that only
1 OSD in this job is built on top of a loop device.
For this reason, and in order to keep the CI healthy, it's
safe removing the device classes coverage.
In addition, since there is only 1 osd, add and configure
tiering in this context makes no sense.

Change-Id: I4638b9badd17a7a75642895623a63753534fd341

commit_message:
This add the cname_lookup middleware for swift proxy.

This commit add the manifest to install and use the cname_lookup
middleware for swift proxy pipeline.

It includes the cname_lookup middleware parameters available in
swift-proxy configuration file.
It also install the required dependency python-dnspython.

Change-Id: If68511fb97bae688e0201fb32928acc9cf68cafc

commit_message:
Refactor BM deployment to use '--work-dir' - [2/2]

We added '--output-dir' just a few weeks ago, now it seems
we want to use '--work-dir'. See:
https://review.opendev.org/775302.

Let's re-factor to use the common consistent working directory.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/780969
Change-Id: Ic903c6d1769d6a6a026208b9857680a115de6c31

I uploaded a 4k+ file broken up into 3 segments, made both the primary and segment containers public, then copied the last segment out to a third container and replaced the original with a symlink. I go to fetch through curl and get my short read: vagrant@saio:~/swift$ curl http://saio/v1/AUTH_test/c/tox.ini | wc -c % Total % Received % Xferd Average Speed Time Time Time Current Dload Upload Total Spent Left Speed 85 4788 85 4096 0 0 58514 0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:-- 59362 curl: (18) transfer closed with 692 bytes remaining to read 4096 But it's still logged as a 200: vagrant@saio:~/swift$ tail /var/log/syslog Sep 21 21:39:52 saio object-6040: 127.0.0.1 - - [21/Sep/2020:21:39:52 +0000] "GET /sdb4/128/AUTH_test/c_segments/tox.ini/slo/1600465773.917852/4788/2048/00000002" 200 - "GET http://saio/v1/AUTH_test/c_segments/tox.ini/slo/1600465773.917852/4788/2048/00000002?multipart-manifest=get" "tx9aaccfe1e700415686baa-005f691da8" "proxy-server 3835" 0.0020 "-" 3820 0 Sep 21 21:39:52 saio object-6030: 127.0.0.1 - - [21/Sep/2020 21:39:52] "GET /sdb4/128/AUTH_test/c_segments/tox.ini/slo/1600465773.917852/4788/2048/00000002?multipart-manifest=get HTTP/1.1" 200 1689 0.003061 (txn: tx9aaccfe1e700415686baa-005f691da8) Sep 21 21:39:52 saio object-6030: STDERR: 127.0.0.1 - - [21/Sep/2020 21:39:52] "GET /sdb7/128/AUTH_test/c_segments/tox.ini/slo/1600465773.917852/4788/2048/00000002?multipart-manifest=get HTTP/1.1" 200 1689 0.003038 (txn: tx9aaccfe1e700415686baa-005f691da8) Sep 21 21:39:52 saio proxy-server: - - 21/Sep/2020/21/39/52 GET /v1/AUTH_test/c_segments/tox.ini/slo/1600465773.917852/4788/2048/00000002%3Fmultipart-manifest%3Dget HTTP/1.0 200 - curl/7.58.0%20StaticWeb%20%20SLO%20MultipartGET - - - - tx9aaccfe1e700415686baa-005f691da8 - 0.0116 SLO - 1600724392.908993483 1600724392.920599222 0 Sep 21 21:39:52 saio proxy-server: - - 21/Sep/2020/21/39/52 GET /v1/AUTH_test/c%252Bsegments/tox.ini/slo/1600465773.917852/4788/2048/00000002%3Fmultipart-manifest%3Dget HTTP/1.0 401 - curl/7.58.0%20StaticWeb%20%20SLO%20MultipartGET - - 131 - tx9aaccfe1e700415686baa-005f691da8 - 0.0019 SYM - 1600724392.922414780 1600724392.924342871 0 Sep 21 21:39:52 saio proxy-server: While processing manifest /v1/AUTH_test/c/tox.ini, got 401 (

This server could not verif...) while retrieving /v1/AUTH_test/c_segments/tox.ini/slo/1600465773.917852/4788/2048/00000002 (txn: tx9aaccfe1e700415686baa-005f691da8) Sep 21 21:39:52 saio proxy-server: 127.0.0.1 127.0.0.1 21/Sep/2020/21/39/52 GET /v1/AUTH_test/c/tox.ini HTTP/1.0 200 - curl/7.58.0 - - 4096 - tx9aaccfe1e700415686baa-005f691da8 - 0.0616 - - 1600724392.864268303 1600724392.925868034 - Sep 21 21:39:52 saio proxy-server: STDERR: Traceback (most recent call last):#012 File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/eventlet/wsgi.py", line 589, in handle_one_response#012 for data in result:#012 File "/vagrant/swift/swift/common/middleware/catch_errors.py", line 52, in enforce_byte_count#012 bytes_left,))#012swift.common.middleware.catch_errors.BadResponseLength: Expected another 692 bytes (txn: tx9aaccfe1e700415686baa-005f691da8) Sep 21 21:39:52 saio proxy-server: STDERR: 127.0.0.1 - - [21/Sep/2020 21:39:52] "GET /v1/AUTH_test/c/tox.ini HTTP/1.1" 200 4583 0.063424 (txn: tx9aaccfe1e700415686baa-005f691da8) I'll keep digging, but thought I ought to give you a heads-up.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-09-22 21:58:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: somehow the difference seems to be if you have an auth token or not i deleted the last segment of an MPU and when I try to download I see: Sep 22 21:51:36 saio proxy-server: While processing manifest /v1/AUTH_test/test/big, got 404 (

The resource could not be foun...) while retrieving /v1/AUTH_test/test_segments/big/slo/1600453228.589863/10485760/1000000/00000010 (txn: tx49106bd258fb47db817f5-005f6a71e8) But when I don't use a token (i did .r:* on both test & test_segments) I get a 200: Sep 22 21:50:57 saio proxy-server: 127.0.0.1 127.0.0.1 22/Sep/2020/21/50/57 GET /v1/AUTH_test/test/big HTTP/1.0 200 - curl/7.58.0 - - 10000000 - tx840798b25b41409ea88da-005f6a71c1 - 0.1994 - - 1600811457.672647953 1600811457.872026920 - and if i use a token i get a 503: Sep 22 21:51:36 saio proxy-server: 127.0.0.1 127.0.0.1 22/Sep/2020/21/51/36 GET /v1/AUTH_test/test/big HTTP/1.0 503 - curl/7.58.0 AUTH_tkf03a308ff... - 10000000 - tx49106bd258fb47db817f5-005f6a71e8 - 0.1971 - - 1600811496.125458002 1600811496.322581053 0"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-09-25 13:40:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1 tim tracked down the issue with the status code on un-authed requests to be some old code in static web'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-09-29 21:19:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-09-30 17:47:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-10-01 14:18:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-10-01 14:20:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: -Code-Review anyway, I'm actually thinking about moving the catch errors byte counting exception catching iteration wrapper into proxy loggings iteration wrapper and working on https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1896518"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-10-01 20:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: may not be needed with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/755639/ (if you add a byte tracking mw, like a second catch errors, before your proxy logging)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-30 23:03:23.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

subject: proxy: Add metrics for short requests and responses
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-04 17:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-09-04 21:57:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-09-15 18:21:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

it seems like this is *maybe* related to lp bug #1895691 (which returns not enough bytes, but logs 2XX)

Except this doesn't try to fix the status codes, it just (maybe?) emits a new metric?

Looking at tests like unit.common.middleware.test_proxy_logging:TestProxyLogging.test_unread_body it's not clear to me AT ALL how we manage to get the metric for short reads to pop since it'll already be 499

Please add detail to the commit message to better demonstrate motivation for this change.
Please add unittests to demonstrate how these metrics are supposed to work."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-09-18 23:07:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I found we're already (ineffectively?) counting bytes here:

https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/middleware/catch_errors.py#L27

and at least with *LO here:

https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/request_helpers.py#L622"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-30 22:51:26.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-26 18:56:24.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I653fbaa43dc005e866e4fb8b6fc0ac0f63623a2a
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I653fbaa43dc005e866e4fb8b6fc0ac0f63623a2a

subject: Have shrinking and sharded shards save all ranges from root
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-06-26 04:33:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-06-26 04:38:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-07-08 05:01:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-07-08 18:40:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-07-13 21:57:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-07-13 23:19:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-07-13 23:35:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-07-13 23:40:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-07-14 18:59:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-07-14 20:52:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)

I don't think I fully grok the related issues this patch it taking on

But, my first priority it to get a manual shrinking process that works, and having shards pull over lapping ranges from the root is a HUGE win.  For my money I think we can just:

@@ -765,7 +767,7 @@ class ContainerSharder(ContainerReplicator):
 
         if shard_range:
             self.logger.debug('Updating shard from root %s', dict(shard_range))
-            broker.merge_shard_ranges(shard_range)
+            broker.merge_shard_ranges(shard_ranges)
             own_shard_range = broker.get_own_shard_range()
             delete_age = time.time() - self.reclaim_age
             if (own_shard_range.state == ShardRange.SHARDED and

and call it a day?"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-07-14 21:40:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-07-15 00:40:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-07-17 19:53:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(4 comments)

there's some good ideas in here"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-07-17 20:57:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-30 22:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Pretty sure all the good ideas from this have landed with other patches.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-26 04:33:47.000000000', 'message': 'wip: Recover from sharding split-brain

Change-Id: I21238d83fa3567eae395a64cee095a957385c2d3
'}, {'created': '2020-07-08 05:01:31.000000000', 'message': "Have shrinking and sharded shards save all ranges from root

Normally, when the root container leader decides that a shard should
shrink, it pushes two piece of information to the shard replicas:

  * its state is now shrinking, and
  * knowledge of the shard range it should be shrinking into.

If the root fails to push that information, there isn't too much harm --
it'll try again on the next round. But the if the shard runs its sharder
before then, currently it will fetch and updates its own range from the
root, giving it the first piece of information but not the second.

Interestingly, the response from the root will include *both* shards,
since both cover the range the shard is responsible for. There's an
opportunity for an optimization: when our own shard (as retrieved from
the root) is shrinking or sharded, we can save all of the shards we
received and get to work immediately, without waiting for the root to
push to us.

This also allows us to recover from a sharding split-brain. A root DB
can be fixed-up offline (currently, likely via some manual, in-a-REPL
broker adjustments), and the shards will pull down all the information
needed to sort themselves out.

Change-Id: I21238d83fa3567eae395a64cee095a957385c2d3

commit_message:
Have shrinking and sharded shards save all ranges from root

Normally, when the root container leader decides that a shard should
shrink, it pushes two piece of information to the shard replicas:

  * its state is now shrinking, and
  * knowledge of the shard range it should be shrinking into.

If the root fails to push that information, there isn't too much harm --
it'll try again on the next round. But the if the shard runs its sharder
before then, currently it will fetch and updates its own range from the
root, giving it the first piece of information but not the second.

Interestingly, the response from the root will include *both* shards,
since both overlap the range the shard is responsible for. There's an
opportunity for an optimization: when our own shard (as retrieved from
the root) is shrinking or sharded, we can save all of the shards we
received and get to work immediately, without waiting for the root to
push to us.

Also, only expand the acceptor's shard range if the donor transitioned
to sharding -- if it was already there, leave it alone.

Between the two, we can now recover from a sharding split-brain. A root
DB can be fixed-up offline (currently, likely via some manual, in-a-REPL
broker adjustments), the shards will pull down all the information
needed to sort themselves out, and the root will leave the shard bounds
alone the next time it goes looking for shrinking candidates.

Change-Id: I21238d83fa3567eae395a64cee095a957385c2d3

subject: ring: Be willing to query nodes with no assignments
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-07-14 04:47:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-07-14 15:06:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

i'm sure this is related to something you're working on in a saio maybe?

Seems like the tail wagging the dog."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-07-14 16:39:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Something from me tinkering with a home cluster, actually -- though I remembered someone else asking about this sort of thing before, too.

Basically, I started out with just a couple big spinners, and put A/C on them knowing full well that I'd regret it later... then did. After a a few too many

 blk_update_request: I/O error, ...

that required a cold boot to resolve, I finally got around to adding an SSD, adjusting weights, rebalancing... and of course creating an availability issue :P

Fair enough, I did something dumb -- but then I was sad to see that I couldn't work around it by just increasing request_node_count -- I'd have to add a tiny bit of weight to the other disks and rebalance again (with an explicit goal that none of the assignments should actually be used)... which *also* feels like the tail wagging the dog. This at least has the benefit that in anything approaching a reasonably-sized, well-configured and maintained cluster, this change has no impact -- request_node_count will ensure we stop digging before we ever hit the if block. (At least, until we do something like https://review.opendev.org/#/c/704435/ that exhaustively checks every handoff.)"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-07-14 23:13:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
ring: Be willing to query nodes with no assignments

This is helpful when trying to remove devices in very small clusters
with a low number of replicas.

Change-Id: I81c66c57362c9a08b55bdb7925f567318d50d02f

[{'created': '2021-02-11 08:59:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix update of trunk subports during live migration

During the live migration trunk subports where updated only based
on the "host_id" field. But when rpc message to update subports
is send trunk's port is still bound to the old host and has
"migrating_to" field in binding:profile set to the new host.
Because of that binding:host_id for the subport's port wasn't updated
proberly and port was set to DOWN on the new host.
That could even cause connectivity break if L2population is used in the
cloud.

This patch fixes that by updating subport's binding:host_id field based
on the migrating_to field if that is available and not empty.

Closes-Bug: #1914747
Change-Id: I98e55242d381ada642ca0729e9aefdea7628c945
(cherry picked from commit e05101c8ac953cc2823b35aaed3d499afc101988)

commit_message:
Fix update of trunk subports during live migration

During the live migration trunk subports where updated only based
on the "host_id" field. But when rpc message to update subports
is send trunk's port is still bound to the old host and has
"migrating_to" field in binding:profile set to the new host.
Because of that binding:host_id for the subport's port wasn't updated
proberly and port was set to DOWN on the new host.
That could even cause connectivity break if L2population is used in the
cloud.

This patch fixes that by updating subport's binding:host_id field based
on the migrating_to field if that is available and not empty.

Closes-Bug: #1914747
Change-Id: I98e55242d381ada642ca0729e9aefdea7628c945
(cherry picked from commit e05101c8ac953cc2823b35aaed3d499afc101988)

commit_message:
Added post-install and post-upgrade hook for jobs in magnum

Chart upgrading was failing due to some immutable fields are needed to upgrade before the jobs can be upgraded. For solving this issue, we
have added the helm.sh/hook annotations with post-install and post-upgrade values.
As for hook-weight annotations, we have added these to control the flow of the jobs with hook creation as the jobs are dependent. Like,
db-init jobs need to run before db-sync and so on.

Change-Id: I5facecb2885f0373e986c62e97abad822f4047dc

commit_message:
Move liberasurecode-git behavior into all tox envs with compilelibs marker

This should let us use that to test against master libec in the gate,
rather than relying on legacy job cruft.

It may complicate cross-project dependencies, but I don't know that we
did that much anyways.

Add a job to test against master libec on centos8, as well.

Change-Id: I33553d9a3432d97a28e4ea685ffc7bc4fb92a340

subject: Add ACL default to allow project read
messages: [{'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2021-03-30 20:26:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2021-03-30 21:43:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-30 20:26:59.000000000', 'message': "Add ACL default to allow project read

Allow a project to read secrets and containers by default.  This is
needed when those objects have no ACL in the database.  The policy enforcer
defaults to False for missing values. [1]  So, attempting to check the
read_project_access for a secret or container will always return False.

If a secret does have an ACL, we'll still return whatever is stored
in the database.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy/src/branch/master/oslo_policy/_checks.py#L335-L338

Change-Id: I584f7b67f2f95caa7c4db3d9d9222d0a9d38442d
(cherry picked from commit 672dc0b5b4de7cfd2d98e4b9040e42e18ba1a6b6)
"}]
commit_message:
Add ACL default to allow project read

Allow a project to read secrets and containers by default.  This is
needed when those objects have no ACL in the database.  The policy enforcer
defaults to False for missing values. [1]  So, attempting to check the
read_project_access for a secret or container will always return False.

If a secret does have an ACL, we'll still return whatever is stored
in the database.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy/src/branch/master/oslo_policy/_checks.py#L335-L338

Change-Id: I584f7b67f2f95caa7c4db3d9d9222d0a9d38442d
(cherry picked from commit 672dc0b5b4de7cfd2d98e4b9040e42e18ba1a6b6)

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifbd7b6210af066068a4554237e7f380536f7ac0a
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifbd7b6210af066068a4554237e7f380536f7ac0a

commit_message:
Respect endpoint, cacert and debug options

When troveclient is used as a plugin for osc, it does not respect
provided endpoint type or cert via osc. This might result in
CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED error with osc, but not with trove shell.

Change-Id: I3d34774e87fcf0fe8efb024d4e6ff80a4e3f49c6

commit_message:
s3api: Ensure backend headers make it through s3api

These are often used for intra-pipeline communication, such as telling
proxy-logging which storage policy an object uses. Gatekeeper still
strips them out, so there's no change to clients.

Change-Id: I1f47b2f101fa496056de42e0f696601560bbb99e

commit_message:
Use Docker healthchecks for freezer services

This change enables the use of Docker healthchecks for freezer
services.
freezer_api returns a 5xx code due to the compatibility of py2
and py3
freezer_scheduler doesn't listen to rabbitmq.

Change-Id: I6e7db31bf063581ba3eab51d6da1afcfa8c1337e
Implements: blueprint container-health-check

commit_message:
Creating stable wallaby for heat-agents

If you want to wait and make another release before the branch is cut,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that
patch to include another release and stable branch point.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday April 02.

Change-Id: Ibf7024f68eeb4ff35e25fa0ff55b9617de46b406

can you please reference the upstream bug #1916758 and add a release notes file?'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-03-29 17:29:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-03-29 21:03:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

We don't want to add new service specific configuration logic in tripleoclient. Can you use an ansible task to check if it's already enable or not? If you need to check across all compute nodes, you could use an external_deploy_tasks.

We can't really rely on "stack_is_new" logic anyway, the stack being new, does not always indicate a new deployment.

Better to test what you actually need to test, such as to check if tsx is enabled when nova_compute is already running.'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-03-30 20:36:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-03-30 21:21:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
> 
> We don't want to add new service specific configuration logic in tripleoclient. Can you use an ansible task to check if it's already enable or not? If you need to check across all compute nodes, you could use an external_deploy_tasks.
> 
> We can't really rely on "stack_is_new" logic anyway, the stack being new, does not always indicate a new deployment.
> 
> Better to test what you actually need to test, such as to check if tsx is enabled when nova_compute is already running.

Thanks for the feedback James, I abandoned this change in favor of this one [1] coupled with the server list running in the deployment playbook to determine if an environment is fresh or not.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/783969'}]

commit_message:
Introducing TsxEnabled global config for overcloud

We need a persistent way of determining if a stack is new or to set the
TSX flag accordingly on the computes.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1923165
Closes-Bug: #1916758
Change-Id: Ia5356c7deafebda49867837fb41138606eac7b1d

[{'created': '2020-09-16 12:07:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix building of the pdf documentation

The .pdf documentation could not be build without errors because the
source code of the documentation contained errors. In addition, there
were other problems:

    - The readme section of the documentation was in .md format
      instead of .rst format. As a result, the created documentation did
      not look good.
    - The .html documentation used deprecated oslosphinx theme instead
      of openstackdocstheme.
    - The /doc folder did not contain requirements.txt file.

This patch fixes the above-mentioned problems and makes sure that
the documentation is generated properly.

Change-Id: I921b15edda433c3e47456488da6d2bda07c34262
Task: 35462

commit_message:
Fix building of the pdf documentation

The .pdf documentation could not be build without errors because the
source code of the documentation contained errors. In addition, there
were other problems:

    - The readme section of the documentation was in .md format
      instead of .rst format. As a result, the created documentation did
      not look good.
    - The .html documentation used deprecated oslosphinx theme instead
      of openstackdocstheme.

This patch fixes the above-mentioned problems and makes sure that
the documentation is generated properly.

Also, this patch updates nodejs4-docs to nodejs10-docs because the
nodejs4-docs was using deprecated nodejs-npm-run-docs job [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/757101

Task: 35462
Depends-On: I738b833109e4caeb58bb391d79d6e63284462bd8
Change-Id: I921b15edda433c3e47456488da6d2bda07c34262

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-26 10:15:55.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I4a806ca1bcc8a7dd506b7121fde9cfe6fb34dcd8
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I4a806ca1bcc8a7dd506b7121fde9cfe6fb34dcd8

... because Mistral is no longer enabled in Undercloud by default.

[{'created': '2021-03-26 15:55:18.000000000', 'message': "Release cloudkitty-tempest-plugin for wallaby

This is the automatic release for cloudkitty-tempest-plugin.
Please +1 if this is ready to go, or -1 if the team needs a little more
time. If so, please update with the new commit hash to use when ready.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.2.0..0044403
72752c4 Add doc/requirements
5f4e88b Use tempest's ServiceClients rather than Manager
05f144b Bump hacking max version to 3.0.1

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic28f84d77140e6a57db9cdf9f559312d763f5266
"}]
commit_message:
Release cloudkitty-tempest-plugin for wallaby

This is the automatic release for cloudkitty-tempest-plugin.
Please +1 if this is ready to go, or -1 if the team needs a little more
time. If so, please update with the new commit hash to use when ready.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.2.0..0044403
72752c4 Add doc/requirements
5f4e88b Use tempest's ServiceClients rather than Manager
05f144b Bump hacking max version to 3.0.1

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic28f84d77140e6a57db9cdf9f559312d763f5266

commit_message:
Allow specifying region of barbican endpoint

This change introduces a new option to define the region to which
the Barbican endpoint belongs. This is required if the deployment has
multiple regions and a single Keystone instance stores multiple
Barbican endpoints for different regions.
This change also ensures that the same interface and region are used
in endpoint detection and api version detection.

Change-Id: If2c0055d45922937e259a8f22f5879c9faa41e35

subject: Abandon networking-midonet
messages:
[{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-19 13:23:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2021-03-22 03:19:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Temporary -1.
Looking at networking-midonet reviews, almost all jobs are broken and they haven't fixed.
I am not sure we can release networking-midonet for Wallaby with the current status.
I think we need to discuss this in the neutron team meeting this week."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-25 12:42:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Any update?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2021-03-29 11:52:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

The discussion happened in http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021376.html.
It seems the majority is to cut a release as-is.
I am okay with it, while I am not a fan to release the code which we know is broken and is expeted to fix soon.

NOTE: Most jobs are broken due to requirement inconsistency caused by an old pylint. We can fix it soon and it allows us to add a release note which warns the current situation in this release.

Clearing my -1. (I would like to wait for while before +1 as release liaison)'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-29 11:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-03-29 14:00:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree we should generally not release a known-buggy version. But we are under pressure to cut all stable/wallaby branches in order to be able to branch requirements / devstack etc. Maybe one intermediary solution would be to cut the branch on current HEAD and then release RC1 on that branch. That may break reno or other tools that assume that process is thoroughly followed... Not sure this is worth the risk.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-29 14:33:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> I agree we should generally not release a known-buggy version. But we are under pressure to cut all stable/wallaby branches in order to be able to branch requirements / devstack etc. Maybe one intermediary solution would be to cut the branch on current HEAD and then release RC1 on that branch. That may break reno or other tools that assume that process is thoroughly followed... Not sure this is worth the risk.

I don't see much difference with the current approach and in addition to that it will complicate the task with potential problem with reno.

The new version will not be more faulty than the existing one and using the current approach will provide more time to deprecate the project properly and eventually to allow to find more volunteers."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-29 15:25:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review Workflow-1

Holding this patch until tomorrow

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021400.html'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-30 08:45:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-03-30 13:59:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Agree on this. Governance patch is up and no objection so far https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/783799'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-30 15:50:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Project is now retired and the TC agreed with that.

- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/networking-midonet/+/783793
- https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet

I think that we can continue.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-03-30 15:53:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2
> 
> Project is now retired and the TC agreed with that.
> 
> - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/networking-midonet/+/783793
> - https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet
> 
> I think that we can continue.

yeah and governance patch is merged now https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/783799'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-30 15:56:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow+1

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2
> > 
> > Project is now retired and the TC agreed with that.
> > 
> > - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/networking-midonet/+/783793
> > - https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet
> > 
> > I think that we can continue.
> 
> yeah and governance patch is merged now https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/783799

Ok then let's go!

Thank you everybody"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-19 13:23:31.000000000', 'message': 'Proposing Wallaby RC1 for networking-midonet

If you wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the release,
someone from your team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that patch
with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday March 26.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 11.0.0..1dcb2d2
af99919 Fix up devstack plugin, libvirt bin renamed in ubuntu
670277f Update master for stable/victoria

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I89be65cc304a439f7ced90788b1f34b9c72dcce7
'}, {'created': '2021-03-30 08:45:21.000000000', 'message': 'Abandon networking-midonet

This project have been retired [1][2][3], these changes reflect that choice.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021415.html
[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22deprecate-networking-midonet%22
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021376.html

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I89be65cc304a439f7ced90788b1f34b9c72dcce7
'}]
commit_message:
Abandon networking-midonet

This project have been retired [1][2][3], these changes reflect that choice.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021415.html
[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22deprecate-networking-midonet%22
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021376.html

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I89be65cc304a439f7ced90788b1f34b9c72dcce7

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I5d1f5b489270f1ee4b0da88d921ae3850f400d80

subject: Fix incorrect lsblk tag and add a virtual media job
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-30 10:22:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incorrect lsblk tag and add a virtual media job

Follow-up to 8dd6589e66d03e45e1d510601da9531a30842cff: PATH is not a
valid lsblk tag, we need to use KNAME with -p flag.

Also add a vmedia job to avoid breakages in the future.

Change-Id: Ifffeac9c1c4d394526d655eaa14c9fe7bd3a1e5e
'}, {'created': '2021-03-30 10:25:49.000000000', 'message': "Fix incorrect lsblk tag and add a virtual media job

Follow-up to 8dd6589e66d03e45e1d510601da9531a30842cff: PATH is not a
valid lsblk tag, we need to use KNAME with -p flag.

Also add a vmedia job to avoid breakages in the future. It's added
non-voting because we have a deadlock with this change:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/783722

Change-Id: Ifffeac9c1c4d394526d655eaa14c9fe7bd3a1e5e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect lsblk tag and add a virtual media job

Follow-up to 8dd6589e66d03e45e1d510601da9531a30842cff: PATH is not a
valid lsblk tag, we need to use KNAME with -p flag.

Also add a vmedia job to avoid breakages in the future. It's added
non-voting because we have a deadlock with this change:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/783722

Change-Id: Ifffeac9c1c4d394526d655eaa14c9fe7bd3a1e5e

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby
messages: [{'account_id': 28062, 'date': '2021-03-30 13:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-26 11:13:52.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I61de9ac4bce2a4bab9df5e763301b3bda53c21b4
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I61de9ac4bce2a4bab9df5e763301b3bda53c21b4

commit_message:
Copy resolv.conf handling from diskimage-builder

The copy in finalise_base runs too late for us, leaving a stale
resolv.conf around (usually copied from the build environment).

Change-Id: I4b89119b8e2eded72973fa12879b1419542ba984

commit_message:
Monkey patch original current_thread _active

Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active
global variable. This solution is based on that documented at:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592

Story: 2007614

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: Ib38bb5625953354bd0afe4ab5fea0ce94a69dce4

commit_message:
Add release file for wallaby release

With this patch, we are adding release files for wallaby.

Also, updating master release file to remove nautilus repo to pull
ceph packages. ceph-ansible is now available in the octopus repo.
nautilus repo was added in [1] but we missed to update
centosci/master-current-tripleo.yml & trunk/master.yml in [2] & [3].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/768599
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/780008
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/779657

Change-Id: Ic214f02bae5e6094ed083b9648e178b661c27a25

picked by the more precise "Get ifcfg facts" task.

commit_message:
Ignore trailing projects from RC1

Some traiing projects follow the cycle-with-rc model however our doc
and our tools doesn't differentiate them during RC1. These project
doesn't have to be released during RC1. These changes adapt our process
accordingly.

Change-Id: I44040bc040f19a75c468d385395323fe0a1f459a

messages:
[{'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-03-27 17:21:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2021-03-29 08:58:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-29 09:40:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-03-29 15:33:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-03-30 07:20:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-27 17:21:29.000000000', 'message': '[FT] Reduce "test_walk_versions" upgrade executions

"_TestWalkMigrations.test_walk_versions" is inherited in other classes
to check a specific DB revision upgrade. The goal is to, from the
previous DB revision, create a testing condition and then upgrade to
the related DB revision. If the upgrade is correct, the test should
pass.

This patch reduces the number of Neutron DB upgrade operations to
just three:
- Upgrade the DB to the previous DB revision to check.
- Upgrade the DB to the related DB revision, after setting the testing
  conditions.
- A final upgrade up to the latest DB revision.

In a testing deployment, this reduces the execution time from 60 seconds
to 35 seconds, without reducing the testing scope.

Change-Id: Iffdc0373ed72aea1320155ea8bec93dce797f27c
Related-Bug: #1911153
(cherry picked from commit c84ae9762c2bae84a3f5f20cfb01b8ef00f46118)
'}]
commit_message:
[FT] Reduce "test_walk_versions" upgrade executions

"_TestWalkMigrations.test_walk_versions" is inherited in other classes
to check a specific DB revision upgrade. The goal is to, from the
previous DB revision, create a testing condition and then upgrade to
the related DB revision. If the upgrade is correct, the test should
pass.

This patch reduces the number of Neutron DB upgrade operations to
just three:
- Upgrade the DB to the previous DB revision to check.
- Upgrade the DB to the related DB revision, after setting the testing
  conditions.
- A final upgrade up to the latest DB revision.

In a testing deployment, this reduces the execution time from 60 seconds
to 35 seconds, without reducing the testing scope.

Change-Id: Iffdc0373ed72aea1320155ea8bec93dce797f27c
Related-Bug: #1911153
(cherry picked from commit c84ae9762c2bae84a3f5f20cfb01b8ef00f46118)

messages: [{'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-03-29 11:24:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-03-29 13:54:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nSame comment here as other Wallaby change - assuming RC2 and note there's not really many tests being run."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-30 12:24:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-29 11:24:21.000000000', 'message': 'Randomize segmentation ID assignation

If plugin "network_segment_range" is not enabled and a new segment
is required, if no segmentation ID is provided in the request, the
segmentation ID assigned is randomly retrieved from the non
allocated segmentation IDs.

The goal is to improve the concurrent network (and segment) creation.
If several segments are created in parallel, this random query
will return a different segmentation ID to each one, avoiding the
database retry request.

Closes-Bug: #1920923

Change-Id: Id3f71611a00e69c4f22340ca4d05d95e4373cf69
(cherry picked from commit 6eaa6d83d7c7f07fd4bf04879c91582de504eff4)
'}]
commit_message:
Randomize segmentation ID assignation

If plugin "network_segment_range" is not enabled and a new segment
is required, if no segmentation ID is provided in the request, the
segmentation ID assigned is randomly retrieved from the non
allocated segmentation IDs.

The goal is to improve the concurrent network (and segment) creation.
If several segments are created in parallel, this random query
will return a different segmentation ID to each one, avoiding the
database retry request.

Closes-Bug: #1920923

Change-Id: Id3f71611a00e69c4f22340ca4d05d95e4373cf69
(cherry picked from commit 6eaa6d83d7c7f07fd4bf04879c91582de504eff4)

[{'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2021-03-26 03:28:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-26 04:05:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Can we merge　https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-nova/+/780770 first?
It helps us get rid of the ugly implementation for deprecation earlier.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-26 04:09:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also, I think https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-nova/+/772455 is worth merging in this cycle for early deprecation.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-26 10:52:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-26 20:56:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-26 20:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-28 12:14:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

Sorry for making the last minute requests.
It would be nice if you can also check https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-nova/+/776931 which involves deprecation.
I know we should make release asap so I'm ok with backporting that change once W release branch is created."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-29 09:21:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Seems like https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-nova/+/776931 is blocked by timeout issue in gate repeatedly.
Maybe we can merge this first and create a rc1, then backport the above change once it is merged into master...'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2021-03-29 09:32:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

I think it's good to clear rc1"}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-29 09:36:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-03-29 13:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-30 12:41:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@zhongshengping

Thank your for your corporation and help to land some patches.
Now all rc1 patches have been merged, so will you submit a release patch to create Wallaby branch ?

Note that one patch for puppet-nova was merged after this patch landed. so it would be helpful if we can create Wallaby release from that commit instead of this commit, if possible.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-30 12:42:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> ...
> Note that one patch for puppet-nova was merged after this patch landed. so it would be helpful if we can create Wallaby release from that commit instead of this commit, if possible.
Or we can stick with creating stable branch from this commit, then I'll backport before GA."}]

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix FlexGroup replication

Currently driver's implementation use the `volume-create` ZAPI call
to create a secondary volume on destination and enable replication.
That call only supports the creation of FlexVols, and must be
replaced by the async call `volume-create-async` when dealing with
FlexGroups.

Change-Id: I07fe2e62a046f7276b6dcd78fd25c89412045d70

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I4b4e33a5ad5054d933470bd85d1a4247794ce3db

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6d0712418198b81d91e952bbb161874fd0e6dcd5

[{'created': '2021-03-26 12:59:00.000000000', 'message': 'Use MultiKeyActionValue action for extra-[env-]vars arguments

This patch adds the ability to pass extra variables and extra
environment variables to the Ansible execution as
key1=value1,key2=value2 instead of using a dict.

This action ensure that ``dest`` is a list. The list will finally
contain multiple dicts, with key=value pairs in them.

This patch also enables the Ansible execution verbosity when using a
different callback by passing --extra-env-vars
ANSIBLE_STDOUT_CALLBACK=default in the command line.

Finally, this change will make the CLI easier to use and faster to type.

'}]
commit_message:
Use MultiKeyActionValue action for extra-[env-]vars arguments

This patch adds the ability to pass extra variables and extra
environment variables to the Ansible execution as
key1=value1,key2=value2 instead of using a dict.

This action ensure that ``dest`` is a list. The list will finally
contain multiple dicts, with key=value pairs in them.

This patch also enables the Ansible execution verbosity when using a
different callback by passing --extra-env-vars
ANSIBLE_STDOUT_CALLBACK=default in the command line.

Finally, this change will make the CLI easier to use and faster to type.

Co-Authored-By: Gaël Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: David J. Peacock <dpeacock@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2432db16f92b3aded51727393d6d8dbfbd61a257

subject: diskfile: Prevent get_hashes from creating missing partition dirs
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-19 20:35:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-19 20:42:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

It was bugging me that running the relinker could go create a bunch of nearly-empty partitions in the new, upper half just because we called get_hashes.

Note that it'd only really affect low-density storage policies where a new partition might not actually have any objects in it (so, dev/test)."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-20 05:09:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Oh! Actually, it affects prod clusters, too, if you're running the relinker multiple times:

* First relinking, a partition in the first quartile gets relinked into the second. No rehashing is done, since it should be covered by cleanup.
* Second relinking, the new part in the second quartile gets checked. None of the hashes need to be relinked, but we still rehash in the upper half of the new partition space just in case!"}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-03-25 04:34:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2021-03-25 04:48:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-25 05:16:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2021-03-25 12:44:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I'm wary of some of the test changes. Also curious about where the change is made."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-25 20:02:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-25 20:08:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-25 20:35:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-25 20:54:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2021-03-25 21:28:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

As expected of Alistair.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-25 22:23:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2021-03-26 12:24:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

I think the solution is better, but there's still some unit tests that assumed get_hashes would create a partition dir and empty hashes.pkl so -1 I'm afraid.

I found a few and fixed here https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/783292

In that follow-up I added a create_partition arg: partly because it felt less tedious, and less prone to regression, than calling mkdirs in ever place we want get_hashes to create the .pkl, and partly because it feels that the dir creation has been an assumed side-effect of get_hashes and it might be a helpful reminder to future-us to see that create_partition=False arg. IDK, open to debate 😊

I also had a go at rewriting the conditions in get_hashes in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/783292, but that's just tinkering - I found all the not's and Nones a little confusing."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-26 21:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-26 21:35:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-26 21:38:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2021-03-29 09:43:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

The core change looks fine, unfortunately I'm -1 on the new valid_suffix() function: I agree that the existing check was weak, but feel that if we're adding a helper function then it should be watertight."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-03-29 17:26:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
diskfile: Prevent get_hashes from creating missing partition dirs

The relinker currently blindly calls get_hashes on partitions in the
new, upper half of the partition space, which can cause extra handoffs
to be created if you're rerunning the relink step for safety.

Even if the relinker were smarter, though, there's no reason that a
curious operator should end up creating empty handoffs just because
they're poking devices with REPLICATE requests

Drive-by: be a little more strict about the "suffixes" we're willing to
put in hashes.invalid and read out of hashes.pkl.

Change-Id: I9aace80088cd00d02c418fe4d782b662fb5c8bcf

commit_message:
Set "context_is_admin" to system scope admin roles

This policy governs manila APIs that are meant to
be cross tenant - so it should default to system
scope in the new secure rbac system.

Also reformat the policy.py file so that we are
consistent with using "rules" as we were doing in
the older releases. Rules abstract keystone
concepts such as roles and scopes.

Change-Id: I31b8eb5232a5cd286db18c2b14833c0682574958
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

      File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/.tox/molecule/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ruamel/yaml/compat.py", line 143

Task: 42176

commit_message:
CI: Fix kayobe-tox-molecule job

The kayobe-tox-molecule job started failing following the release of
ruamel.yaml 0.17.0, which dropped support for Python 2:

      File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/.tox/molecule/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ruamel/yaml/compat.py", line 143
        dbgprint = print  # to fool checking for print statements by dv utility
                       ^
    SyntaxError: invalid syntax

Restrict ruamel.yaml to earlier versions.

Change-Id: Iaa578a7fae747c47a733408d09684fb0705d0d82
Story: 2008785
Task: 42176

commit_message:
Backport neutron resource tags

This is a bulk backport of changes from master setting
tag's on neutron resouces. Setting up these tags prior
releases will ease the upgrade/migration to not manage
the resources in heat.

Also squashes depend-on change:
  Set dns_name propery on ports and networks

  Neutron's dns_assignments field includes a nice pice of
  structured data. This is a prerequirement for Designate
  usage. (No plan's to use that, but being a bit ready
  does'nt hurt.)

    {"hostname": "my-vm",
     "ip_address": "192.0.2.16",
     "fqdn": "my-vm.example.org."}

  Enable for the undercloud:
   - dns_domain_ports ml2 extension driver

Partial-Implements: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
(cherry picked from commit 28f2a709124f62469acafb64110f755edec82636)
(cherry picked from commit 1e7015081d19c1df0470e1a2654d7425f42e4b41)
(cherry picked from commit 6d39c90a22d850cf449f1900cff32e8b2a1803c3)
(cherry picked from commit 679ecaada05768e96a1fcddb7aeb78fc6735809f)
Change-Id: Ibadb7df92525a0c10f7e82fe6b2bc0dff8316ef6

has totally sense to do that!'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-03-30 09:42:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

did a bit of digging at the failed py27/py35 tests

they are both failing on pifpaf invocation but in both cases it looks like the test actually pass?


        * https://storage.bhs.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_771/776116/1/check/openstack-tox-py27/77171e9/testr_results.html
        * https://0bbefa60e58db64a443e-c5e3119faf041de7c26d678d93fa5afa.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/776116/1/check/openstack-tox-py35/b66144d/testr_results.html

anyone has any ideas how we can fix it? it is not a case of bumping to a newer version as it isn't constrained to some max version right now: https://opendev.org/openstack/aodh/src/commit/21453ee6784e8e15ad7991dd3bd78823bf291813/setup.cfg#L47"}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2021-03-30 10:07:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I've seen backwards incompatible updates getting into 
- tenacity (version 7.0)
- sqlalchemy-utils
- kombu (version 5.0 requires python3)

All that should be covered by upper-constraints. However, pifpaf is running external services like gnocchi, which can also be affected by this, bot does not use upper constraints."}]

commit_message:
Remove deprecated tripleo scenario multinode jobs from experimental

In [1] we are moving these jobs to deprecated. In order to be able
to eventually remove them we need to remove any references to these
jobs in zuul layouts.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/774575

Change-Id: I15e7b664fb9d747e03bf001d755726c8c0c52b79

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0c2bb639d446c0a065721470e582682a5c70bee5

The os-brick 4.3.1 release fixes a critical data loss bug that can be
triggered by reconfiguring [libvirt]/volume_use_multipath while volumes
are attached.

The os-brick also bumped the min eventlet version from 0.26.1 to 0.30.1
since 4.2.0, nova's last minimum. So here such transitive eventlet version

Change-Id: I0d5df271dec1c6035229b02ec45e03abad6f27e7

commit_message:
Bumping min os-brick ver to 4.3.1

The os-brick 4.3.1 release fixes a critical data loss bug that can be
triggered by reconfiguring [libvirt]/volume_use_multipath while volumes
are attached.

The following requirements and lower-requirements are also bumped as
introduced into os-brick by Ie7dcc859e1291bd1d50b1ae516be38d8732de836:

    os-brick 4.3.1 depends on eventlet>=0.30.1
    os-brick 4.3.1 depends on oslo.concurrency>=4.4.0
    os-brick 4.3.1 depends on oslo.service>=2.5.0
    os-brick 4.3.1 depends on oslo.serialization>=4.1.0
    os-brick 4.3.1 depends on oslo.utils>=4.8.0
    os-brick 4.3.1 depends on pbr>=5.5.1
    os-brick 4.3.1 depends on requests>=2.25.1
    os-brick 4.3.1 depends on tenacity>=6.3.1

Co-Authored-By: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1921381
Change-Id: I0d5df271dec1c6035229b02ec45e03abad6f27e7

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach[1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and

[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

(cherry picked from commit b1528f9cabc19bf615d950213de0e6514b9f4121)
Change-Id: I1d85665f5f9f3aa7131d469a33f0c1a12449449f
"}]
commit_message:
Move flake8 as a pre-commit local target.

The goal here is to avoid conflicts between flake8 and hacking version each
2 days.

Inspired from nova's approach[1].

The flake8 version to install will be determined by hacking and
requirements[2] will stay aligned instead of relying on different versions.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/.pre-commit-config.yaml#L26-L35
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/hacking/src/branch/master/requirements.txt#L1

(cherry picked from commit b1528f9cabc19bf615d950213de0e6514b9f4121)
Change-Id: I1d85665f5f9f3aa7131d469a33f0c1a12449449f

commit_message:
Filter storage protocol in the scheduler

The share protocol requested was being
ignored by the scheduler and this would
cause shares to get scheduled to hosts
that don't support the specified protocol.

Change-Id: I2e87264865b645781c481383c039fecbfd7c6eb1
Closes-Bug: #1783736

commit_message:
Clarify optional lower bounds testing

Lower bounds testing was an optional thing to test but
projects raised question over maintaining it
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019659.html
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019672.html

During the discussion on ML and in the TC meeting, it is decided to
clarify that it is optional to test, and projects can drop it
if they want.
- http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/tc/2021/tc.2021-03-18-15.01.log.html#l-146

This commit makes few sentence updates about optional lower bounds testing.

Change-Id: I4b0e7d032845586720bfeb64761340ebc770d0e6

commit_message:
Disable Tacker installation

Currently Tacker installation with RDO Ussuri is broken. Let's skip
installation until the issue is fixed in RDO.

Change-Id: Ie7abcab1665c0d23f2fe920d3b57c7abc346c801
Related-Bug: #1920659

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-29 19:39:17.000000000', 'message': 'Allow Ceph RBD pool job to leave failed pods

This patchset will add the capability to configure the
Ceph RBD pool job to leave failed pods behind for debugging
purposes, if it is desired. Default is to not leave them
behind, which is the current behavior.

Change-Id: Ife63b73f89996d59b75ec617129818068b060d1c
'}]
commit_message:
Allow Ceph RBD pool job to leave failed pods

This patchset will add the capability to configure the
Ceph RBD pool job to leave failed pods behind for debugging
purposes, if it is desired. Default is to not leave them
behind, which is the current behavior.

Change-Id: Ife63b73f89996d59b75ec617129818068b060d1c

the proper version during unit tests of puppet-tripleo this change
bumps version of puppet-memcached used during tests.

break interfaces used in current puppet modules it is considered to
be safe to bump that minor version at this moment.

commit_message:
[Ussuri and before] Bump puppet-memcached for tls support

Currently in TripleO we are implementing tls support for memcached,
which requires puppet-memcached >= 3.7.0. This change bumps version of
puppet-memcached used during tets to the one with tls support, so that
we can use the proper version of puppet-memcached in unit tests of
puppet-tripleo.
Because there are no changes made until 3.7.0 which is likely to
break interfaces used in current puppet modules it is considered to
be safe to bump that minor version at this moment.

Related-Bug: #1921716
Change-Id: Ib213e151b92d33d30f4335fcd93f86dbab8f0198

commit_message:
Fix automatic quota sync for temporary volumes

When using the automatic quota refresh via `until_refresh` and `max_age`
configuration options the calculated quota usage by the refresh will not
be correct if there are temporary volumes (such as those created from
snapshots for backups).

Normal quota usage calculation does not work like this, as it has admin
metadata stating that those are temporary volumes and are not used to
increase/decrease quota usage.

This patch fixes this by modifying existing filter that ignores
migrating volumes so it can also ignore temporary volumes based on their
admin metadata.

Closes-Bug: #1919161
Change-Id: I0fd89028684c1406f427f4c97b120ece5cf2780b

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7a2a12b37a6b7425d76795f45fd57c44c26c35fb

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-19 19:31:08.000000000', 'message': 'Restore old config-download symlink to new location

Change I5fc78158bbff468576eaddf1924e67a6666213e3 switched the symlink
source/target of the config-download dir for the consistent working dir
from new->old instead of old->new.

We want the old location at ~/config-download/<stack> to be a symlink to
the new location, and store the actual files in the new location. The
symlink is for backwards compatibility.

This patch also adds a migration for any files at the old location to
the new location, if the new location does not yet exist.

Change-Id: I189bd751066cfaebd951d92d8371250aac5b4e9b
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2021-03-23 01:12:53.000000000', 'message': 'Restore old config-download symlink to new location

from new->old instead of old->new.

We want the old location at ~/config-download/<stack> to be a symlink to
the new location, and store the actual files in the new location. The

commit_message:
Restore old config-download symlink to new location

Change I5fc78158bbff468576eaddf1924e67a6666213e3 switched the symlink
source/target of the config-download dir for the consistent working dir
from new->old instead of old->new.

We want the old location at ~/config-download/<stack> to be a symlink to
the new location, and store the actual files in the new location. The
symlink is for backwards compatibility. A migration is added for any
files at the old location to the new location, if the new location does
not yet exist.

This patch also changes the default working dir to be a directory under
~/overcloud-deploy for the stack name instead of
~/overcloud-deploy-<stack>. Given multi-stack and multi-overcloud
support, defaulting to using a single directory is a more
straight forward approach and easier to collect.

Change-Id: I189bd751066cfaebd951d92d8371250aac5b4e9b
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add parameter for chap_algs in iscsid.conf

We need to be able to specify the CHAP algorithms in iscscid.conf
so that we can, for example, remove MD5 from the list.

This will allow iscsid to run on FIPS enabled systems where MD5
is disallowed.

Co-Authored-By: Alan Bishop <abishop@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I89023603147e21d5c211041f70fc2c988d5f4de1

[{'created': '2021-03-26 00:44:11.000000000', 'message': 'Bump RPC version for the scheduler rpc call

https://review.opendev.org/768137 fixed
bug #1908963 by adding a timestamp field to
the "update_service_capabilities" rpc API
call to the scheduler service.

It's possible that during an upgrade, the
share service is upgraded before a given
scheduler service, and an updated client
could start sending messages with this
extra data that wasn't expected. Lets
bump the version so that the client
messages are just waiting for an updated
scheduler to show up and consume the
messages rather than raise syntax
errors.

Partial-Bug: #1908963
Change-Id: I0d9fc311ffd296bd6153b7190f8f5c42f494a39d
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Bump RPC version for the scheduler rpc call

https://review.opendev.org/768137 fixed
bug #1908963 by adding a timestamp field to
the "update_service_capabilities" rpc API
call to the scheduler service.

It's possible that during an upgrade, the
share service is upgraded before a given
scheduler service, and an updated client
could start sending messages with this
extra data that wasn't expected. Lets
bump the version so that the client
messages are just waiting for an updated
scheduler to show up and consume the
messages rather than raise syntax
errors.

Partial-Bug: #1908963
Change-Id: I0d9fc311ffd296bd6153b7190f8f5c42f494a39d
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-09-27 10:00:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix health policy attach/detach action when messaging.MessagingTimeout occurred

Health policy attach/detach from cluster still successful when send
notification to health manager service with messaging.MessagingTimeout.
This is very bad for the cluster health manager，the following things may happen:
1. When do attach from cluster when messaging.MessagingTimeout occurred，
   Register cluster to health registry will be failed,
   and then the cluster will not do health check, even though
   the policy has attached.
2. When do detach from cluster when messaging.MessagingTimeout occurred,
   Unregister cluster to health registry will be failed,
   and then the cluster will still do health check, even though the policy
   has detached.

Change-Id: Iedf1f0b77e9034ccb81a9073b936875c2259fb10
Closes-Bug: #1897443
